page.title: 18MANOR FARM_HAMPRESTON.
page.content: At the end of the 19th century there were 3 farms in the village_today one remains.Manor Farm is owned by Sir Richard Trehaine and has been in the family since 1936.The farm has been improved,the farm house was re_built in 1913 but the acreage has remained unchanged.The land is used for mixed farming and there is a pedigree dairy herd. Farm produce is marketed over a wide area.For a hundred years milk was sent to Bournemouth but in 1984 it was sent to Southampton instead.Other produce is marketed as follows: Sturminster Newton Market:Cattle. Blandford and Poole:Grain. Swanage and neighbouring towns: Potatoes.
